title: Kanye West Calls Social Media 'Modern-Day Cigarettes,' But Still Admires Twitter CEO
text:
The world knows Kanye West as a popular musician with a rather eccentric personality. Genius isn't without its moments of crazy, as they say.

His world views never stop being borderline controversial, and now in a recent interview with Apple Music host Rob Lowe, he unravelled some more dark things from his past and how he blames social media for it.

Reuters

Kanye West in the interview (while promoting his Jesus Is King' album) confessed how during his early days he got addicted to pornography after he got his hands on his father's Playboy magazine. While he has been trying to recover from this addiction, according to him, social media has only made this struggle more difficult.

According to Kanye West, social media is "modern-day cigarettes."

However, oddly, even though he despised social media, he expressed his immense admiration for Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey.

According to Kanye, Dorsey is "incredibly smart and a visionary." His admiration was partially for his pilot stock-trading app that allows people to invest in a stock for a dollar. He stated, "You've gotta honour living founders, those are the great great great great grandfathers of what's being built."

Reuters

Social media and smartphone addiction are one of the few major issues surrounding the teens these days. Kids are competing to be popular and cooler on social media by posting everything about their life and creating unhealthy benchmarks to compete with others.

According to a recent study from the Queensland University of Technology (QUT), people addicted to phones have reported a considerable loss in sleep as well as drop-in work productivity, blaming their phones for it.

The researchers replicated questions from a similar 2005 survey, and found that 31.3 percent of people in 2018 blamed their smartphones for losing sleep. In 2005, that was the complaint for just 5.5 percent of people.
